alert.note: Alert for Colfax; Mora (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 29 at 3:27PM MDT until July 29 at 6:30PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... The Cook`s Peak burn scar in... Southwestern Colfax County in northeastern New Mexico... North Central Mora County in northeastern New Mexico... * Until 630 PM MDT. * At 327 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain over the Cook`s Peak Burn Scar. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Any debris flow can consist of rock, mud, vegetation and other loose materials. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding in and around the Cook`s Peak Burn Scar. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of areas in and around the Cook`s Peak Burn Scar. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Ocate, Black Lake, Rayado and Miami. This includes the following highways... State Road 434 near Mile Marker 19...and between Mile Markers 22 and 26. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Runoff from rainfall will cause elevated water levels within vulnerable drainages in and downstream of the Cook`s Peak fire burn area. Do not camp along streams and rivers. Remain alert when hiking in steep, narrow canyons. Know where you are relative to low spots and drainages.
